intro: Humata gaimardiana, commonly known as the Gaimard's humata, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. Humata gaimardiana is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and humid environments.
